Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the amount that well-known charities overpay their CEOs and the small percentage they spend on helping people.
Understate: The claim understates the compensation of the head of the Salvation Army and the CEO of Ronald McDonald House Charities.
Falters at times: The claim falters in accurately representing the financial information and compensation of the charities mentioned.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support in providing accurate and up-to-date information about the charities' financial practices.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that high CEO compensation and low percentage spending on programs automatically make a charity "bad."
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the financial practices of the charities mentioned that are not considered in the claim.
